chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Petit Frere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 320 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Programs.The Court would entertain a motion to modify the length of Initial Confinement - IF the defendant provides useful information about any other co-conspirators engaged in the same or similar crime to law enforcement officials.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution of $4,847.72 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $1,919.80 to J.B.; $2,927.92 to J.Z.

Extradition Cost and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

DNA Sample Ordered.

Court Costs WAIVED.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

No contact with victims.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
DNA Sample Ordered. Pay DNA Surcharge.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Defendant Samuel Petit Frere in court, in custody, with attorney Amy C Scholz.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by T.E.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  Credit for 320 days.
- Court would consider modifying the initial confinement based on a motion to amend showing defendant hs shared valuable collaborative information to law enforcement
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- Extradition costs of $1,446.00
- Restitution of $4,847.72 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $1,919.80 to J.B.; $2,927.92 to J.Z.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Sample ordered
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with victims.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
